meanings.definition: A short, simple tune or melody.
meanings.sent1: She hummed a little ditts while walking to school.
meanings.sent2: The radio played a catchy ditts that got stuck in my head.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside seemed to chirp a cheerful ditts together.
meanings.sent4: His laughter had a musical ditts that echoed in the room.
meanings.sent5: The wind carried a haunting ditts through the empty streets.

meanings.definition: To repeat or recite something, especially a short verse or line.
meanings.sent1: He ditts the same joke every time we meet.
meanings.sent2: The children love to ditts their favorite nursery rhymes.
meanings.sent3: She would often ditts her lines in a funny accent.
meanings.sent4: The news anchor would ditts the headlines with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to ditts the multiplication table aloud.

meanings.definition: A written or printed copy of a musical composition.
meanings.sent1: The musician handed out ditts of the new song to the band members.
meanings.sent2: She kept a folder full of ditts for her piano lessons.
meanings.sent3: The library had a collection of ditts from famous composers.
meanings.sent4: The ditts on the music stand were well-worn from practice.
meanings.sent5: He framed the ditts of his favorite song as a decoration in his room.
